com.example.mediaintentactivity

Class PhotoIntentActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • androidx.core.app.ComponentActivity
              • androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

                  • com.example.mediaintentactivity.PhotoIntentActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, androidx.appcompat.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, androidx.core.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, androidx.core.view.KeyEventDispatcher.Component, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner

    public class PhotoIntentActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    This class takes photos and video using camera intents, saves media to package data in external storage Then Displays photos and video in UI

    References

    https://www.techotopia.com/index.php/Video_Recording_and_Image_Capture_using_Camera_Intents_-_An_Android_Studio_Example
    http://developer.android.com/shareables/training/PhotoIntentActivity.zip
    https://developer.android.com/training/camera/photobasics
    https://developer.android.com/training/camera/videobasics
    Version:
    1.0 2019
    Author:
    Adapted from various sources see references above., chris coughlan 2019

      PhotoIntentActivity() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.io.File createMediaFile(int requestCode)
      This Method creates and returns two file types with date-time added to the unique name value, it is called by the dispatchTakePictureIntent() and the dispatchTakeVideoIntent()
      private void dispatchTakePictureIntent()
      This Method is launched from two of the take image Button onClickListeners in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take a photo The method then replaces an already prepared image file using createMediaFile(int) saved to package data in external storage Returns Activity Result and Activity Request
      private void dispatchTakeThumbIntent()
      This Method is launched from Thumbnail Button onClick in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take an image This method then places the location of the temporary image into data extras Returns onActivityResult, the Activity Request and the Extra data with a thumbnail
      private void dispatchTakeVideoIntent()
      This Method is launched from video Button onClick in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take a Video The method then replaces an already prepared Video file using createMediaFile(int) saved to package data in external storage Returns onActivityResult with Activity Request.
      void galleryAddPic()
      Updates the media scanner to tell the system a media file exists assumption is the createMediaFile(int) method was run, so this cannot be called from the dispatchTakeThumbIntent() Intent method.
      private void handleCameraVideo(android.net.Uri videoUri)
      Adds a media player to the video view we are displaying the recorded video in
      static boolean isIntentAvailable(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String action)
      Indicates whether the specified action can be used as an intent This method queries the package manager for installed packages that can respond to an intent with the specified action If no suitable package is found, this method returns false http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2009/01/can-i-use-this-intent.html
      protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, android.content.Intent data)
      Overrides onActivityResult, contains a switch, checks what Action is taken in the above class and processes the return result data as required REQUEST_IMAGE_CAPTURE - on OkResult, checks for full size or predetermined size image based on mSetSize value: 1) on full size sets imageView with image converted to bitmap 2) on predetermined imageView size runs setPic(String path) REQUEST_THUMB_CAPTURE - on OkResult gets the location of the thumbnail from Extra data and sets the imageView REQUEST_VIDEO_CAPTURE - on OkResult runs galleryAddPic() and handleCameraVideo(Uri)
      protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Overrides onCreate, inflates the UI from photo_intent.xml and sets the views (widgets for this activity) Sets Four Button onClick listeners for image / video capture buttons in the UI On each button run the setBtnListenerOrDisable method to disable the button if the intent cannot be called Each button opens one of the dispatch* methods and the setVisibility(int state)
      protected void onPause()
      Overrides the onPause, we need this to clean up and release video resources
      protected void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Overrides the onRestoreInstanceState so we can do something with the values we saved during the onSaveInstanceState ensures the ImageViews and the VideoView re-initialises with the images/video on screen rotation
      protected void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
      Overrides the onSaveInstanceState so we can send values from memory to be used when the instance is restored Keeps values we need in memory when the view gets torn down on screen rotation
      private void setBtnListenerOrDisable(android.widget.Button btn, android.view.View.OnClickListener onClickListener, java.lang.String intentName)
      This runs the isIntentAvailable method, if the intent is not available (phone does not have video capability for example, this method disables the associated button so the user does not crash the application
      private void setPic(java.lang.String path)
      This Method resizes an image file so it fits into an ImageView of pre-determined size After resizing it converts to a bitmap and inserts the image into the ImageView so it displays in the UI
      void setVisibility(int state)
      This method contains a switch that controls the visibility of the views (Image or video) in the UI

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Overrides onCreate, inflates the UI from photo_intent.xml and sets the views (widgets for this activity) Sets Four Button onClick listeners for image / video capture buttons in the UI On each button run the setBtnListenerOrDisable method to disable the button if the intent cannot be called Each button opens one of the dispatch* methods and the setVisibility(int state)
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - bundles the activity state for the application

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility(int state)
        This method contains a switch that controls the visibility of the views (Image or video) in the UI
        Parameters:
        state - integer controlling the state of visibility on views in photo_intent.xml UI

      • createMediaFile

        private java.io.File createMediaFile(int requestCode)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This Method creates and returns two file types with date-time added to the unique name value, it is called by the dispatchTakePictureIntent() and the dispatchTakeVideoIntent()
        Parameters:
        requestCode - to tell it what type of file to create
        Returns:
        image file object that can be used by the Camera intent to populate when it takes images/videos
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • setPic

        private void setPic(java.lang.String path)
        This Method resizes an image file so it fits into an ImageView of pre-determined size After resizing it converts to a bitmap and inserts the image into the ImageView so it displays in the UI
        Parameters:
        path - path to the image file that needs resizing

      • dispatchTakePictureIntent

        private void dispatchTakePictureIntent()
        This Method is launched from two of the take image Button onClickListeners in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take a photo The method then replaces an already prepared image file using createMediaFile(int) saved to package data in external storage Returns Activity Result and Activity Request

      • dispatchTakeThumbIntent

        private void dispatchTakeThumbIntent()
        This Method is launched from Thumbnail Button onClick in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take an image This method then places the location of the temporary image into data extras Returns onActivityResult, the Activity Request and the Extra data with a thumbnail

      • dispatchTakeVideoIntent

        private void dispatchTakeVideoIntent()
        This Method is launched from video Button onClick in the onCreate Method, it launches the camera Intent so user can take a Video The method then replaces an already prepared Video file using createMediaFile(int) saved to package data in external storage Returns onActivityResult with Activity Request.

      • handleCameraVideo

        private void handleCameraVideo(android.net.Uri videoUri)
        Adds a media player to the video view we are displaying the recorded video in
        Parameters:
        videoUri - is a Uri with the video location returned from onActivityResult

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        Overrides the onPause, we need this to clean up and release video resources
        Overrides:
        onPause in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • galleryAddPic

        public void galleryAddPic()
        Updates the media scanner to tell the system a media file exists assumption is the createMediaFile(int) method was run, so this cannot be called from the dispatchTakeThumbIntent() Intent method.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        Overrides the onSaveInstanceState so we can send values from memory to be used when the instance is restored Keeps values we need in memory when the view gets torn down on screen rotation
        Overrides:
        onSaveInstanceState in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        outState - bundle of values returned from memory for use when the instance is restored

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        protected void onRestoreInstanceState(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Overrides the onRestoreInstanceState so we can do something with the values we saved during the onSaveInstanceState ensures the ImageViews and the VideoView re-initialises with the images/video on screen rotation
        Overrides:
        onRestoreInstanceState in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - current values saved by the application when instance is destroyed

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                android.content.Intent data)
        Overrides onActivityResult, contains a switch, checks what Action is taken in the above class and processes the return result data as required REQUEST_IMAGE_CAPTURE - on OkResult, checks for full size or predetermined size image based on mSetSize value: 1) on full size sets imageView with image converted to bitmap 2) on predetermined imageView size runs setPic(String path) REQUEST_THUMB_CAPTURE - on OkResult gets the location of the thumbnail from Extra data and sets the imageView REQUEST_VIDEO_CAPTURE - on OkResult runs galleryAddPic() and handleCameraVideo(Uri)
        Overrides:
        onActivityResult in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • isIntentAvailable

        public static boolean isIntentAvailable(android.content.Context context,
                                        java.lang.String action)
        Indicates whether the specified action can be used as an intent This method queries the package manager for installed packages that can respond to an intent with the specified action If no suitable package is found, this method returns false http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2009/01/can-i-use-this-intent.html
        Parameters:
        context - The application's environment.
        action - The Intent action to check for availability.
        Returns:
        True if an Intent with the specified action can be sent and responded to, false otherwise.

      • setBtnListenerOrDisable

        private void setBtnListenerOrDisable(android.widget.Button btn,
                                     android.view.View.OnClickListener onClickListener,
                                     java.lang.String intentName)
        This runs the isIntentAvailable method, if the intent is not available (phone does not have video capability for example, this method disables the associated button so the user does not crash the application
        Parameters:
        btn - the button to be disabled
        onClickListener - associated onClick the on button
        intentName - name of intent being called by the buttons child method
